intro: Turanga euphratica, commonly known as the Euphrates turanga, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the Middle East. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, white to greenish flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are finely divided and often used in traditional medicine for their purported anti-inflammatory properties. Turanga euphratica is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
